title: Voltage Gradients
fullText: Where electrical equipment is in contact with pool or tub water, failure of insulation may result in a hazardous voltage appearing across or through the water. A very low voltage is sufficient to present a hazard to persons immersed in the water. Protective measures for such equipment shall include: (a) use of RCDs with a fixed rated residual current not exceeding 30 mA to protect circuits supplying Class I (earthed conductive parts) equipment; or (b) electrical separation, in accordance with Clauses 1.5.5.5 and 7.4.
